intro: Lychnophora albertinioides, commonly known as the Albertine lychnophora, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest for its potential medicinal properties.
